Fishing.Quote: The texas rig is a good rig for casting worms and other soft body baits into weedy, snag prone areas.
Largemouth Bass are voracious eaters, consuming everything from Blue Gill to bats.
Largemouth Bass come in two subspecies, the longer lived Northern Largemouth and the larger growing Florida Bass.
Largemouth bass are native to limited freshwater ranges in the Central and Eastern United States, but do to popularity amongst anglers, have spread across the US and around the world.
Largemouth bass are ambush predators and like to stay near places they can hide in, like sunken logs or dense weeds.
If you’re after bass, go for weed-less baits.
Northern Pike and Bass are cannibals.
The biggest Largemouth Bass ever caught weighed 22 lbs. [2.2 lbs to the kg]
Fly fishing uses false casting with a long pole and weighted fishing line to cast super light, top water baits.
Fly fishers makes use of artificial baits that mimic insects in various stages of development to lure fish that like to eat drowning bugs.
Good things come to those who bait.
One of the best ways to catch trout is to fly fish.
Look for small surface feeding birds to find good spots to fly fish. More birds means more insects around and better chance of getting a bite!
When fly fishing, look for bugs on the water, that’s what the fish are looking for.
The fish aren’t all hiding in deep water, many fish take shelter and hunt in the shallows and weeds.
If you’re fishing the shore, try not to stand too close to the bank, especially in clear water. The fish might spot you and get spooked.
Braided line is generally lighter and stronger than monofilament line, however, it doesn’t stretch so it’s up to your rod to absorb shocks.
It’s not that the fish aren’t biting today, it’s that they aren’t biting for you.
Catawba worms make great bait, so if you’re ever in the right part of the American South, make sure to get some.
Bluegill go by a lot of different names: bream, brim, perch, sunfish, sun perch, spiny bream. Only one of those is fake.

Real.Quote: The rook is the horse one.
The Spanish Opening is one of the first openings taught to new chess players.
The Queen’s 9 points, that’s final.
The farther a piece is from its color’s king, the smarter it is.
The pawns are peasant levies, so the more of them that you lose, the more your economy will suffer.
Pawns are situationally very powerful: they can promote, attack en passant, and, in numbers, can deny areas of the board.
Sometimes it is strategically advantageous to bait you opponent with a piece to set up the development of a different piece.
The Berlin Defense is the funniest way to inform your opponent that you are a civil engineer.
If you can’t think of anything else, move a knight or a pawn to open. You came here without a plan, what have you got to lose?
A chess match trains your enemy how to beat you, thus in order to avoid giving the opposition an advantage the only reasonable course of action is to not play the match.
Chess is a horror game from the king’s perspective.
Try asking your bishop to convince the opponent’s bishop to excommunicate the opponent’s king.
Have you attempted to negotiate an armistice? That might give you enough time to come up with a plan.
Castling can get you out of a pinch, it’s a shame you can only do it once.
The Bishop can be a hard piece to develop and leverage effectively. Moving the king or queen side pawn can be pretty critical to this end.
Having a lone pawn in the center of the board is not necessarily a bad thing. It’s still denying moves and creating opportunities.
Knights are better than Bishops in the early game, when more pieces are on the board, but as things open up, Bishops dominate.
When you play chess, you are not the king, you are a cruel supernatural force that compels the king to engage in bloody and fruitless wars.
Put your rook on an open file. Just try it, trust me.
In 1255 it was decided that pawns would only move forward due to desertion concerns.

Special.Quote: Perhaps the conflict is not with your opponent.
You ever cast, and cast, and cast, all day long just to find you never really cared about catching anything in the first place? It was about the water wasn’t it? Something in the blue…
How long have you been here?
